caption: I constantly come getting some food in this spot. I liked the speedy customer service and well prepared dishes. Highly recommended.
Get the garlic knot crust pizza. So so good 🤤
Pizza was great.
Best service, pizza and fettuccine alfredo anywhere. Love this spot. And they have great window art for all the holidays! Park Slope institution.

They provide awesome services and tasty pizza freshly made. The reason I took stars away is because of their sanitation and cleanliness especially under Covid. As we know they are cash only, I can’t believe what I’ve seen. Two guys worked that day. The guy who took my cash while picking up a call handed the phone directly to the other who got called while he was making my whole pie with bare hands!!!!!! Unbelievable:(((

Roma Pizza is dope! Classic NY pizza joint with an excellent Italian hero, chicken parm and Caesar on point (with the salty commercial croutons I love but never keep in my house), and ooey gooey baked pastas to satisfy your need for cheese! If you know what I’m talking about, check this place out ;)
Nice pizza

Review is based on service.. called from Fairfield Inn .9 miles away and told it's too far for delivery ...I guess you have to be within walking distance and then what's the point of advertising that you offer delivery
Never delivered my order. 2 hours of waiting and not picking up their phone and now the place is closed.
No pizza specials. Cash only. I will take my business elsewhere. Thank you.
Walked in and walked out. Mop smell, ambiance, 0 cust serv drove me right out. Nasty looking place.
The best pizza I've had in a while
Their food is so good I recommend the calzones

I've been going to Roma Pizza in Park Slope since 1978 when they were on 5th Ave in Park Slope. It's my favorite childhood pizza. Even now that I live in New Jersey I still pay them a visit at least 3 times a year.  The owners were always very nice and the employees are equally nice. Great place to pop in for great pizza and a great neighborhood.
Decent Not great
best pizza place in brooklyn. love it and cannot wait for them to reopen!
The best pizzeria in Brooklyn......

Update 3/7/2020, We're visiting family today and again enjoyed ourselves with zucchini sticks and some pizza. Area residents love Roma because of their food and great staff!😉 This is our go to pizzeria when visiting family in the area. Staff are always friendly and helpful if it's eating there or taking out.

(Translated by Google) NY style pizza. Great local pizza spot in Park Slope. The tomato sauce makes the pizza one of the best in BK. The other classic joint is Fiscati in Bk heights ... Italian still running the spots unlike Many other places in NYC. Highly recommend the Fresh Mozza slice.  If you are in Park Slope and are looking for a place to eat good pizza, quickly, I recommend Roma. Great tomato sauce. A restaurant where Italians are always present unlike Bcp other Pizzeria. To try !  (Original) Pizza NY style. Great local pizza spot in Park Slope. The tomato sauce makes the pizza one of the best in BK. The other classic joint is Fiscati in Bk heights... Italian still running the spots unlike Many other places in NYC. Highly recommend the Fresh Mozza slice.  Si vs etes a Park Slope et recherchez un endroit ou mqnger une bonne pizza, rapidement, je conseil Roma. Super sauce tomate. Un resto ou les italiens sont toujours present a la difference de Bcp d’autres Pizzeria. A essayer !
Yes their pizza is excellent but I have a soft spot for the Italian Hero which I buy every time I'm flying out of town.
Very good pizza
If it's good enough for Chris Rock...
We can't get enough of the fresh mozzarella pizza! Travel father then they would deliver to get it
Food is ok
Great food
Soup was very good & warm service
The pizza is super hot and really good. Cash only, the employees are nice.
(Translated by Google) Very good pizza  (Original) Muy buena pizza
Pepperoni slice and a root beer for $6 - nice and quick, with a friendly vibe

Many types of their pizza and  sauces are tasty, however more often than not, their by the slice pizzas are laying out for long periods of time giving them an old dried out look. Yes, they throw them in the oven to warm up, but a dried and old pizza is just that;  regardless how you may try to rejuvenate it. In fairness to them,  every other pizza joint does the same thing.
Great staff, good pizza, even salads are solid
Fantastic slice and great classic pizzeria feel on the inside.

I was pleasantly surprised by this pizza shop! I ordered a slice of buffalo chicken pizza and it was actually delish! It’s not super inexpensive, one slice runs you $5, but it’s not crazy either. Cute Italian decor, seating for plenty, staff is SUPER friendly! Would visit again!
(Translated by Google) I am very slow but everything is fresh food and worth waiting for  (Original) Soy muy lentos pero todo es comida fresca y vale la pena esperar

The pizza is absolutely horrible. It literally taste like one of the dollar pizzas that they sell in the Bronx.The dough tasted overcooked and the sauce was very bland. There was a good amount of cheese applied to the slice but in all honestly it really is one of the worst pizzas I ever had🤦🏾‍♂️💯

We accidentally discovered this place. But what a discovery.. one of the best pizza I have ever had in NYC. It has a very thin base and the sauce is authentic and amazing. I haven't really tried their other offering. But I guess they will be good as well. Would recommend it to anyone visiting park slope
Nice food with reasonable pricing!
One of two GREAT pizza in BK.  (Won't name the second.) Lol.
A hidden gem for italian food
Most amazing pizza in the world
Great pizza, cash only to eat in restaurant. If you order online using "seamless" you can put on credit card and pick it up to take out or have it delivered.
Nice neighborhood slice joint. Better than the average cheap slice.
Enjoy there pasta and there grandma pizza
Best pizza ever
great food
Pizza is good and the staff is nice. They even said goodbye as we left. No one does that.

The best slice of mushroom pizza I have eaten in a very long time! I literally haven't eaten a pizza slice so tasty!!! The crust is nice and thin n yet not very dry or crunchy. It's got a fresh unique taste to it. The sauce is very fresh and 👌.Took a train and  Went back to this place just to eat the slice of mushroom pizza again. Definitely a must try!
On of the best pizzas I have ever tried. Really classic , thin , crisp melting slices.
Delicious pizza and excellent service

Interesting on all accounts in this part of Brooklyn.  Strong slice choices and everything in between.  Very excited staff!  We had the margharite, thin crust and sweet sauce..delicious.  Cheese more traditional.
It was my go to place when i lived in Park Slope.
Cash only. Pizza sauce is very sweet; too sweet  for me. No parmesan shaker out with the other toppers. Good neighborhood vibes tho.
Best pizza in park slope!
I have lived in this neighborhood for years, and love their old style pizza. Always great!!
Very Rude!! Costumer service does not know how to speak the costumer!! The place has foul smell 😷😷watery pizza!!! Disgusting !!!flies everywhere🤮🤮

I had the regular pizza slices, they tasted like cardboard, you can get better frozen pizza at a 1/3 of the price. Also, when I asked for hot pepper flakes, the guy behind the counter told me to share the one dispenser they have with a table across the room that was using it. Speaks volumes with how customers are treated here.  It’s important to mention that I used to come here regularly a few years back, I’ve visited three times in the past year and each time is a disappointment. I have finally accepted that the delicious pizza I once had here is long gone.
The staff is very nice, the pizza is delicious. The slices are still a 5/5 after you refrigerate and reheat them. This is by far the best pizza in Park Slope.

The slice was delicious but a little pricey at $4.50; I guess that’s New York, baby! Could have been a little warmer, but I enjoyed my slice and there was plenty of interesting options to choose from, especially as someone who does not eat meat.
Excellent fresh pizza.
Good and friendly staff with both take out and eat in food from an extensivee. U.
Best place in the neighborhood. Crunchy crust, cool ppl.
Decent place.  Nice paintings and pictures of famus people.
The fresh mozzarella pizza is really good
Love the pizza
Great old style pizza place. Food is great. Nice selection. Reasonably priced. They only take cash.
Doughy crust, slightly too thick for my taste. The reheated slice I had was below average for Brooklyn standards. I've had better pizza in the Pacific Northwest.
Standard NYC slice
Hawaiian pizza,  great place, great service
The pizza is so good but I was really dissapointed that I brought an expired drink. I would come here for pizza definitely but to buy a drink, I would check first.
The best pizza shop in ParkSlope.

Seriously, after traveling down from Boston, we were just looking for a belly-filler, these pizzas are amazing! Went back there a couple of days later rather than chance the quick-bite offerings of Manhattan.
Got to be one of my favorite pizza places in Brooklyn. Staff there treats you like family and the food is amazing. Prices are good too!!

Good pizza places in Brooklyn often have a signed cast photo from Goodfellas or Sopranos. This place inexplicably has a big portrait of one of America's worst presidents. Oh well.  Good pizza (available as pies or slices) and calzones. There's a big full menu but I've never ordered anything but those two. I wish specialty slices weren't so much more than basic ones, but that's pretty much every slice place.  Often infested with teenagers.

Been a Park Slope resident for the past 10 years. Was more of a 5th Ave guy when it came to pizza. The past few months since my gym shut down, I have been a regular now to 7th Ave! Let me say this about Roma - the best old school pizza in the area. What a variety of dishes. Phil and his staff are amazing. Read some yelp reviews about the rowdy crowds after-school - duh! Of course, young kids like pizzerias to go after-school - it is passage of life and for making memories. Some of negative people out here need to enjoy life and support these mom and pop businesses.  I'll be in for my regular slice this week for sure.
A friendly neighborhood spot with reasonable pizza. Lots of kids and families when I went, but it’s Park Slope, so of course.
My favorite local pizza spot. Their margarita slice is one of the finest. Every now and then, you'll see their garlic knots crust slice; try one.
The penne vodka yummm  Cash only for carry out
Good solid slice
The favorite pizza place for my 2 sons and myself!  Great pizza, great people :)

Great pizza and pasta! Not the cheap $1 slices, but quality options!  The staff are great here and there is an ATM on site if you forgot cash for your order. Check out the artwork on the windows around holidays.

This might appear to be an ordinary pizza place but when you eat the pizza you will find something beyond the ordinary. For one, you will not get heart burns on your way home. Also I never got anything bad here. Everything here is made to perfection. I have been visiting this place for more than 30 year and never been disappointed.
Amazing pizzaria. Been going here my entire life, great staff, even better pizza
One of Park Slope's oldest and best pizza restaurants. In addition to pizza they also offer traditional Italian dishes - we have been coming here for over 25 years.
Eat there every time I work in the neighborhood. Pizza ok, but I'm ADDICTED TO the calzones and cheese steak sandwiches.
4,50 for a small buffalo chicken slice...
Ok it
Grandma pie is the way tongo
Best pizza spot for the price. Food is Great! :)
Delicious Food, Drinks, etc.
Cheap and cheerful pizza by the slice. The HUGE menu offers every variety of Italian food you can think of. You are better off sticking to the pizza!
Always great. Cash only.
Great Neighborhood pizza joint!  Best chicken rolls.

I grew up going here and have lived and traveled all across NYC and the world including Italy, but I will always come back to Roma's if given the chance, a slice or pie of their Fresh Mozzarella is still my go to pick if I ever had to choose a last meal.
I never get heart burns from their pizza unlike most other places. Their pizza is the best.
Best NY style pizza in brooklyn.
The best Pizza in Park Slope!!!!
Dirty & gross
To bad they only accept cash.
Very good pizza and great vibes

Phil the owner and John the counter manager are great guys. They greet everyone with courtesy and respect. They remember their regulars and make everyone feel like family. I highly, highly recommend Roma Pizza.
Fresh traditional style pizza & great new pizza topping combos..don't forget about there killer subs.... Hand down the best pizzeria in Park Slops
Great, quick neighborhood pizza joint

The pizza at this spot is fast, fresh, and tasty. Get a slice of whichever pie just came out of the oven. The Sicilian is outstanding.  The staff is always friendly.  Beware: this is Park Slope, so you'll almost always see/ hear kids and families in here.
Perfect fast lunch, variety, and made to order mozzarella sticks!
Its ok. Pizza is 3 stars right out of the oven, 2 after 5 minutes. The quality is spotty, sometimes its good but sometimes not so much.
Roma's is the best pizza in neighborhood. Anybody who says different doesn't know the neighborhood.

Great place to get a slice in Park slope. My family and have been ordering from them for years and never disspointed us. The previous owner was very polite the staff treated us like family. Sadly he passed always and his son took over his a great guy as well. The paste and pizza is a amazing.
Sauce is spectacular
Good pizza. There's better around but it's definitely good.
Doughy, not crispy, average pepperoni. Alfredo was nice but some sediment(?) in it. Disappointed.
Interesting place. Good pizza.

The pizza was great and the space was nice and the people were nice. If you arrive with a small child that *has to pee*!!! .... there *is* a bathroom behind the counter and there *is* a sign to let you know...you just might not notice it at first...so rest assured, you may still get to enjoy the awesome pizza with a refreshed small child.
Excellent place to go for a couple of slices!
(Translated by Google) It's a good place  (Original) Es un buen lugar
Friendly people and pizza is good. I visit this place often because it is convenient and near my workplace.
I love their pizza but mostly their meatlovers pizza.

Can't believe this place is in here.It must be a paid advert.Owner is a real mob who threats you when you write a review that he doesn't agree with on yelp.Pizza is average, burnt,expensive and tasteless.They don't take cards and size is only one. Delivery is late and cold so what to like?Nothing to like as it has been a place I wish I didn't know it exist.The area its surrounded by nice pizza places and decent customer service people so can't see a reason for anyone to enter this place.
Good pizza served quick!
(Translated by Google) Pedcb  (Original) Pedcb

I ordered a plate of penne pasta with marinara sauce for 8$ and was expecting a pretty large portion. I guessed wrong. They gave me a tiny portion that barely satisfied my hunger. The location was convenient for me though, and the workers were friendly.
The fresh mozzarella pie is the kind of pizza you pine for whenever you leave the city and the first thing you get when you return home.
Its cheese is the best.I love there tomatoes sauce too.Good bread.
Good pizza, if a bit over-priced.
its so freakin good and I'm so obssed me and my friends go their all the time love ya
Brooklyn pizza. This place does not disappoint. Get a slice and coke and continue on with your day. No frills just decent NY style pizza.
So delicious!!! Highly recommend the Sicilian pizza it was incredible
Best pizza in Brooklyn. There is something for everyone. Great friendly staff and the owner has an eye for detail.
(Translated by Google) Pasta Fina  (Original) Pasta Fina
I love bringing my kid here. It's clean, the pizza is great. The staff is super friendly. And seriously best music playing every time i come in.
I'm in there about once a week and lately by the time I get to the front of the line my slices made the way I like it.
THE best slice of upside down Sicilian in brooklyn. It took me 3 years to find the best pizza here. Better than L & B
Great pizza
God stuff Tasty sauce!

Get the Grandma slice or Grandma pie. The place gets crowded with toddlers running wild so place your order for on the go. If I am in the area and in the mood for a quick bite (pizza), I come here to order. It's probably best to place an order over the phone if you order a whole pie as opposed to a slice, it takes 15 mins to bake.
The atmosphere is nothing special, but they're friendly and their mozzarella pizza is excellent.

Awesome specialty slices, classic Brooklyn service, and the best fountain soda in the neighborhood!  Try the chicken broccoli or sicilian.  Good for delivery too but you can't enjoy the old school booths unless you go there.
I always order to go. Their pizza's are delicious and greasy. This is a good local place to get pizza.

This is our favorite pizza place in Brooklyn, We come here all the time and love the food.   The pizza's crust is amazingly crispy, the sauce is sweet and they use high quality cheese. Prices are very reasonable and you cant even think about ordering only one slice.

Family owned and operated...what else more can you want? How about some of the best pizza in all of Brooklyn? Well that is what you get. Phil the owner is continuing his family tradition for over 25 years!
Try the fresh mushroom fresh mozzerella slice.

This isn't the greatest place to grab a slice in the neighborhood, but if you don't have a choice, why not stop by? Certainly beats the other restaurants in the area and is the quickest service you'll find around.  Minus - Where is the bathroom here?
